The morning I wished to hear the **Dao/Way**, and the evening I would die without regret.
By chance, in the **藏外** *(outer Daoist canon)*, I obtained *The Yinyu Transmission* (*Yinyu zhuàn*), unknown whose era it came from.

Its words and logic are **profound and boundless** (玄邈),
Like **sealing** (契) the **nature of the Way** (自然).
Thus I compiled it and appended my own annotations,
Hoping that future **virtuous men** (君子) would not lose the **Dao/Way’s essence** (道旨).

The **Yellow Emperor’s Yinyu Scripture** (黄帝阴符经) states:
*"To observe the **Dao/Way** of Heaven, to grasp Heaven’s actions—this suffices.
To observe the **Dao/Way** of Nature—there is nothing to observe.
One does not observe it with the eyes, but with the heart.
The heart is deep and subtle, yet sees nothing it cannot perceive,
Thus it can illuminate Nature’s **virtue/power** (性).
This **virtue/power** (性) is deep and subtle yet able to illuminate—
This is what is called ‘**Yin**’ (阴).

To grasp Nature’s actions—there is nothing to grasp.
Thus one does not grasp it with the hands, but with **mechanisms** (机).
**Mechanisms** (机) are flexible and unrestricted, yet can **seal** (契) Nature’s **principles** (理).
Only when flexible and able to **seal**—
This is what is called ‘**Fu**’ (符).
To illuminate with the heart, to **seal** with **mechanisms**—
Thus the meaning of ‘**Yinyu**’ (阴符) is complete.*

Li Quan took **Yin** (阴) as ‘**darkness**’ (暗),
And **Fu** (符) as ‘**harmonization**’ (合),
Using this text as a preface—
How **blind** (昧) his understanding was!

Thus Heaven has **five thieves** (五贼), and those who see them prosper.
The **five thieves** (五贼) are: **fate** (命), **phenomena** (物), **timing** (时), **achievement** (功), and **spirit** (神).

The *Transmission* (传) says:
*"The **Dao/Way** of the **Sage** (圣人) is vast yet does not neglect the minute,
And refined yet does not conceal its flaws.
Thus, when dwelling in peace, they follow the **Dao/Way** and manifest **virtue/power** (德) to transform it,
And when encountering peril, they employ **strategic means** (权) and unleash **mechanisms** (机) to rescue it.
Their purpose is to rectify Heaven and Earth,
Their plan is to benefit all mankind.
Thus, using **great righteousness** (大义) to eliminate harm in the world,
Using **great benevolence** (大仁) to promote benefit in the world,
Using **ultimate correctness** (至正) to redress injustice in the world,
Using **absolute impartiality** (至公) to curb private interests in the world—
The schemes that **invert scripture yet harmonize the Dao/Way** (反经合道) have five names,
Which the **Sage** (圣人) **transmutes** (禅) and calls ‘**thieves**’ (贼).
Yet the world relies on them—
Then they are called **virtue/power** (德).
Thus, the **thief** of **fate** (命) is such that people know of Heaven yet not its **thief**,
Hence the Yellow Emperor replaced the Flame Emperor.
The **thief** of **phenomena** (物) is such that people know of Heaven yet not its **thief**,
Hence Emperor Yao replaced Emperor Zhi.
The **thief** of **timing** (时) is such that people know of Heaven yet not its **thief**,
Hence Emperor Shun replaced Emperor Yao.
The **thief** of **achievement** (功) is such that people know of Heaven yet not its **thief**,
Hence Great Yu replaced Emperor Shun.
The **thief** of **spirit** (神) is such that people know of Heaven yet not its **thief**,
Hence Tang of the Shang overthrew the Xia dynasty.
King Wu of the Zhou overthrew the Shang dynasty.
Thus, those who see them prosper—
This is the natural way of prospering.
The Duke of Zhou took the **thief** of **fate** (命) as **strategic means** (用味),
Using it as an allegory.
Li Quan did not comprehend—
He took the Yellow Emperor’s **thief** of the **fate** (命) of a maiden
And the daytime ascent of a vapor as wrongdoing.
The **five thieves** (五贼) lie within the heart,
Their application lies in Heaven;
The universe lies within the hands,
And ten thousand transformations arise from the body.
The *Transmission* (传) says:
*'The establishment of **virtue/power** (德) is clear,
The use of **mechanisms** (机) is subtle.
When unleashed from within, it is seen without—this is all.*
How could it mean **wielding arms to create banditry and chaos** (称兵革以作寇乱)?
To see its **mechanisms** (机) and grasp them,
Even if the universe is vast,
It does not depart from the **palm and fingers** (掌握),
Much less its smaller aspects!
To know its **spirit** (神) and embody it,
Even if myriad things abound,
They cannot escape one’s **chest and mind** (胸臆),
Much less their fewness!
Nature’s **creative transformations** (造化) and their **force** (力) belong to me—
Is this not **grand** (盛)?
Is this not **great** (大)?
Li Quan and others took the **five thieves** (五贼) as the **five flavors** (五味),
Saying that following them leads to **immortality** (神仙) and **non-death** (不死).
This is the **most egregious distortion** (诬) of the **Dao/Way**!

Heaven’s **nature** (性) is **humanity** (人),
And the **human heart** (人心) is **mechanisms** (机).
To establish the **Dao/Way** of Heaven is to **settle** (定) **humanity** (人).
The *Transmission* (传) says:
*'**Humanity** (人) refers to Heaven’s **nature** (性),
**Mechanisms** (机) refer to the human heart.'*
**Human nature** (人性) is originally **profound and naturally harmonious** (玄合),
Thus the **Sage** (圣人) can embody the **five thieves** (五贼).

When Heaven unleashes the **killing mechanism** (杀机), dragons and serpents rise from the land;
When **humanity** (人) unleashes the **killing mechanism** (杀机), Heaven and Earth **reverse and shift** (反复).
The *Transmission* (传) says:
*'Heaven’s **mechanisms** (机) expand yet do not produce life,
Heaven’s **mechanisms** (机) relax yet do not cause death.
Heaven has **expansion and relaxation** (驰张), its use has **flaws and virtues** (否臧).
When expanded, the **killing mechanism** (杀威) takes action;
When relaxed, the **killing mechanism** (杀威) vanishes.
The **mechanisms** (机) of **humanity** (人) are likewise.
Heaven uses **qi** (气) as its **威** (威),
And **humanity** (人) uses **virtue/power** (德) as its **mechanisms** (机).
In autumn and winter, the **Yin qi** (阴气) is severe and congealed—
This is Heaven’s **expanded killing mechanism** (张杀机),
Thus dragons and serpents fear and **hibernate** (蛰伏).
When winter passes and spring arrives, **Yin** retreats and **Yang** grows—
This is Heaven’s **relaxed killing mechanism** (驰杀机),
Thus dragons and serpents rejoice and **awaken** (振起).
Heaven has **cold and warmth** (寒暄),
And **virtue/power** (德) also has **cold and warmth** (寒暄).
When **virtue/power** (德) and **punishments** (刑) are strict and orderly,
This is the ruler’s **expanded killing mechanism** (张杀机),
Thus the lowly fear and submit.
When **virtue/power** (德) and **punishments** (刑) are **imbalanced** (偏),
This is the ruler’s **relaxed killing mechanism** (驰杀机),
Thus the wicked rejoice and **run wild** (驰骋).
Rank has **high and low** (尊卑), mirroring Heaven and Earth,
Thus it is said:
*"When Heaven unleashes the **killing mechanism** (杀机), dragons and serpents rise from the land,
And banditry and chaos originate;
When **humanity** (人) unleashes the **killing mechanism** (杀机), Heaven and Earth **reverse and shift** (反复),
And the **high and low** (尊卑) are thus **overthrown** (革)."*
The Duke of Zhou, Zhuge Liang, and others,
When they **slaughtered thousands** (杀人过万),
Great winds and tempests arose, and the day darkened as night—
They took this as Heaven and Earth **reversing and shifting** (反复),
But their error was profound.

Heaven and **humanity** (人) **harmonize virtue/power** (合德),
And ten thousand transformations rest on a **foundation** (基).
The *Transmission* (传) says:
*"Heaven dispenses **mechanisms** (机) of calamity and fortune above,
And the ruler moves **mechanisms** (机) of benefit and harm below.
Thus those with **virtue/power** (德) prosper through ten thousand transformations,
And reach the heights of kingship;
Those without **virtue/power** (德) decline through myriad changes,
And meet their end in ruin.
Thus it is said: Heaven and **humanity** (人) **harmonize virtue/power** (合德),
And ten thousand transformations rest on a **foundation** (基).
This is the **naturally so** (自然而然)."*

**Nature** (性) has **skill and clumsiness** (巧拙),
Which can be **concealed** (伏藏).
The *Transmission* (传) says:
*"The **nature** (性) of the **Sage** (圣人) is **skilled** in applying wisdom,
Yet **clumsy** in exerting strength.
When in adversity or peril, they **plot with the Dao/Way** (谋道) to aid it;
When facing the **strong and the clever** (强与明), they **conceal righteousness** (伏义) to retreat.
This is essential for **governing the state** (理国),
And likewise for **employing military force** (用师).
The **evil** (邪) of the **nine orifices** (九窍) lies in the **three critical points** (三要),
Which can be **activated or stilled** (动静)."*

chunks.original_text: 《传》曰：九窍之用，三要为机。 三要者，机、情、性也。 机之则无不安； 情之则无不邪； 性之则无不正。 故圣人动以伏其情，静以常其性，乐以定其机。 小人反此，故下文云：太公为三要，为耳、目、口。 李筌为心，神、志，皆忘机也。 俱失《阴符》之正意。 火生于木，祸发必克； 奸生于国，时动必溃。 知之修炼，谓之圣人。 《传》曰：夫木性静，动而生火，不觉火盛，而焚其质。 由人之性静，动而生奸，不觉奸成而乱其国。 夫明者见彼之隙以设其机，智者知彼之病以圆其利，则天下之人，彼愚而我圣。 是以生者自谓得其生，死者自谓得其死，无为无不为，得道之理也。 天生天杀，道之理也。 天地，万物之盗； 万物，人之盗； 人，万物之盗。 三盗既宜，三才既安。 《传》曰：天地以阴阳之气化为万物，万物不知其盗。 万物以美恶之味飨人，人不知其盗。 人以利害之谟制万物，万物不知其盗。 三盗玄合于人心，三才静顺于天理。 有若时然后食，终身无不愈； 机然后动，庶类无不安。 食不得其时，动不得其机，殆至灭亡。 故曰食其时，百骸治； 动其机，万化安。 人知其神而神，不知其神所以神也。 《传》曰：时人不知其盗之为盗，只谓神之能神。 《鬼谷子》曰：彼此不觉谓之神。 盖用微之功着矣。 李筌不知此文意通三盗，别以圣人、愚人为喻，何甚谬也。 日月有数，大小有定，圣功生焉，神明出焉。 《传》曰：日月有准，运数也； 大小有定，君臣也。 观天之时，察人之事，执人之机，如是则圣得以功，神得以明。 心冥理合，安之善也。 筌以度数为日月，以余分为大小，以神气能生圣功神明，错谬之甚也。 其盗机也，天下莫能见，莫能知也。 君子得之固躬，小人得之轻命。 《传》曰：其盗微而动，所施甚明博，所行极玄妙。 君子用之，达则兼济天下，太公其人也。 穷则独善一身，夫子其人也。 岂非择利之能审乎？ 小人用之，则惑名而失其身，大夫种之谓欤？ 得利而亡义，李斯之谓欤？ 岂非信道之不笃焉？ 瞽者善听，聋者善视。 绝利一源，用师十倍。 三返昼夜，用师万倍。 《传》曰：瞽者善于听，忘色审声，所以致其聪。 聋者善于视，遗耳专目，所以致其明。 故能十众之功。 一昼之中三而行之，所以至也。 一夜之中三而思之，所以精也。 故能用万众之人。 李筌不知师是众，以为兵师，误也。 心生于物，死于物，机在于目。 《传》曰：心有爱恶之情，物有否臧之用。 目视而察之于外，心应而度之于内。 善则从而行之，否则违而止之，所以劝善而惩恶也。 筌以项羽昧机，心生于物； 以符坚见机，心死于物。 殊不知有否臧之用。 天之无恩而大恩生，迅雷烈风莫不蠢然。 《传》曰：天以凶象咎征见人，人能儆戒以修德。 地以迅雷烈风动人，人能恐惧以致福。 其无恩而生大恩之谓也。 李筌以天地不仁为大恩，以万物归于天为蠢然。 与《阴符》本意殊背。 www.taoismcn.com 至乐性余，至静性廉。 《传》曰：情未发谓之中，守中谓之常，则乐得其志而性有余矣。 性安常谓之自足，则静得其志而廉常足矣。 筌以奢为乐性，以廉为静，殊乖至道之意。 天之至私，用之至公。 《传》曰：自然之理，微而不可知，私之至也。

*«The Transmission* says:
The **use** (用) of the **nine orifices** (九窍) lies in the **three critical points** (三要) as the **mechanism** (机).
The **three critical points** (三要) are **mechanism** (机), **emotions** (情), and **nature** (性).
To **govern** (则) **mechanism** (机) is to have all things **settled** (安);
To **govern** (则) **emotions** (情) is to have all things **perverse** (邪);
To **govern** (则) **nature** (性) is to have all things **upright** (正).
Thus, the **Sage** (圣人) **activates** (动) to **conceal emotions** (伏其情),
**stills** (静) to **preserve nature** (常其性),
And **delights** (乐) to **fix mechanism** (定其机).
The **petty man** (小人) does the opposite, hence the following passage:
*"Duke of Zhou* (太公) **established** (为) the **three critical points** (三要) as **ears, eyes, and mouth** (耳、目、口);
*Li Qun* (李筌) **established** (为) the **heart, spirit, and will** (心、神、志), all **ignoring mechanism** (忘机).
Both **lost** (俱失) the **true meaning** (正意) of the *Yin Fu* (《阴符》).

Fire **arises** (生) from wood, yet **disaster** (祸) **strikes** (发) and must be **overcome** (克);
Treachery **arises** (生) from the state, yet **opportunity** (时) **strikes** (动) and must be **exploited** (溃).
To **know** (知) this and **refine oneself** (修炼) is called being a **Sage** (圣人).
*The Transmission* says:
*"Wood’s **nature** (性) is **still** (静),
Yet when it **moves** (动), fire **arises** (生).
If one does not **perceive** (觉) the fire’s **flourishing** (盛),
It will **burn** (焚) its own essence.
Similarly, **human nature** (人之性) is **still** (静),
Yet when it **moves** (动), treachery **arises** (生).
If one does not **perceive** (觉) treachery’s **completion** (成),
It will **disrupt** (乱) the state.

The **clear-sighted** (明者) see **others’ weaknesses** (彼之隙) to **set their mechanism** (设其机),
The **wise** (智者) know **others’ flaws** (彼之病) to **harness advantage** (圆其利),
Then the people of the world—**they** (彼) are **foolish** (愚), **I** (我) am **Sage** (圣).
Thus, the **living** (生者) claim to have **secured life** (得其生),
And the **dead** (死者) claim to have **secured death** (得其死).
**Non-action** (无为) yet **nothing is left undone** (无不为),
This is the **principle** (理) of **attaining the Dao/Way** (得道).

**Heaven’s creation and destruction** (天生天杀) is the **principle** (理) of the Dao/Way (道).
Heaven and Earth are the **thieves** (盗) of **ten thousand transformations** (万物);
Ten thousand transformations are the **thieves** (盗) of **humanity** (人);
Humanity is the **thief** (盗) of **ten thousand transformations** (万物).
When the **three thieves** (三盗) are **properly aligned** (既宜),
And the **Three Powers** (三才) are **settled** (既安).
*The Transmission* says:
*"Heaven and Earth **transform** (化) **ten thousand things** (万物) through **yin-yang qi** (阴阳之气),
Yet **ten thousand things** (万物) do not **know** (知) their **theft** (盗).
**Ten thousand things** (万物) **nourish** (飨) **humanity** (人) with **good and evil flavors** (美恶之味),
Yet **humanity** (人) does not **know** (知) their **theft** (盗).
**Humanity** (人) **controls** (制) **ten thousand things** (万物) with **advantage and harm** (利害之谟),
Yet **ten thousand things** (万物) do not **know** (知) their **theft** (盗).
The **three thieves** (三盗) **mysteriously unite** (玄合) in the **human heart** (人心),
And the **Three Powers** (三才) **remain still and follow** (静顺) the **principle of Heaven** (天理).

**Food** (食) is **obtained** (得) only at its **time** (时), yet **one’s body** (终身) **never fails to heal** (无不愈);
**Mechanism** (机) is **activated** (动) only when **ready** (然后), yet **all things** (庶类) **never fail to settle** (无不安).
If **food** (食) is not **taken at its time** (得其时),
Or **mechanism** (机) is not **activated when ready** (动其机),
Then **ruin and extinction** (灭亡) are near.
Thus it is said:
*"To eat at its time, the hundred bones are **regulated** (治);
To move with mechanism, ten thousand transformations are **settled** (安).*

**Humanity** (人) knows its **spirit** (神) and **spirit** (神) is **manifest** (神),
Yet does not know how **spirit** (神) **manifests** (所以神).
*The Transmission* says:
*"The people of their time do not know that **theft** (盗) is **theft** (之为盗),
Only saying that **spirit** (神) can **manifest** (能神).
*Ghost Valley Master* (《鬼谷子》) says:
*"When **both sides** (彼此) are **unaware** (不觉), it is called **spirit** (神).
This is the **refinement** (功) of **subtlety** (微) **achieved** (着矣).
Li Qun did not understand this passage’s **unified meaning** (意通三盗),
But **separately** (别) used **Sage** (圣人) and **foolish man** (愚人) as **analogies** (喻),
How **erroneous** (谬) is this!

The **sun and moon** (日月) have **fixed measures** (数),
And the **great and small** (大小) have **set distinctions** (定).
From this, **Sage’s great deeds** (圣功) **arise** (生),
And **spirit and clarity** (神明) **emerge** (出).
*The Transmission* says:
*"The sun and moon have **fixed standards** (准), **cyclical movements** (运数);
The **great and small** (大小) have **set distinctions** (定), **ruler and subject** (君臣).
To **observe Heaven’s time** (观天之时),
To **examine humanity’s affairs** (察人之事),
To **grasp humanity’s mechanism** (执人之机),
Then the **Sage** (圣) **achieves great deeds** (得以功),
And **spirit and clarity** (神) **emerge** (得以明).

When the **heart is tranquil** (心冥) and **principle is united** (理合),
This is the **best of stillness** (安之善).
Li Qun **mistakenly took** (以) **calculating cycles** (度数) as the **sun and moon** (日月),
And **remaining portions** (余分) as the **great and small** (大小),
Saying that **spirit-qi** (神气) can **generate Sage’s great deeds** (生圣功) and **spirit and clarity** (神明),
How **greatly mistaken** (错谬) is this!

As for their **theft of mechanism** (盗机),
No one under Heaven can **see** (见) or **know** (知) it.
The **noble man** (君子) who **attains** (得) it **preserves himself** (固躬),
The **petty man** (小人) who **attains** (得) it **risks his life** (轻命).
*The Transmission* says:
*"Their **theft** (盗) is **subtle** (微) yet **movement** (动) is **clear and broad** (甚明博),
Their **actions** (行) are **extremely mysterious** (极玄妙).
The **noble man** (君子) who **uses** (用) it—
When **prosperous** (达), he **saves all under Heaven** (兼济天下), **Duke of Zhou** (太公) being such a one.
When **impoverished** (穷), he **perfects himself alone** (独善一身), **Master Kong** (夫子) being such a one.
Is this not the **ability to discern advantage** (择利) with **great precision** (审)?

The **petty man** (小人) who **uses** (用) it—
Then he is **bewildered by fame** (惑名) and **loses himself** (失其身).
Is this not **Zhong the Great Officer** (大夫种)?
To **gain advantage yet lose righteousness** (得利而亡义),
Is this not **Li Si** (李斯)?
Is this not the **failure to uphold the Dao/Way** (信道) with **sincerity** (笃)?

The **blind** (瞽者) are **good at hearing** (善听),
The **deaf** (聋者) are **good at seeing** (善视).
To **cut off advantage at its source** (绝利一源), **military force** (用师) is **tenfold** (十倍).
To **return three times** (三返) **day and night** (昼夜), **military force** (用师) is **ten thousand-fold** (万倍).
*The Transmission* says:
*"The blind are **good at hearing** (善于听),
**Forgotten** (忘) of **colors** (色) and **attentive** (审) to **sounds** (声),
Thus they **achieve great acuity** (致其聪).
The deaf are **good at seeing** (善于视),
**Abandoning** (遗) **ears** (耳) and **fixing on eyes** (专目),
Thus they **achieve great clarity** (致其明).
Hence they can **perform the deeds of ten thousand troops** (能十众之功).
To **move three times** (三而行) within **one day** (一昼之中),
This is how they **reach** (所以至).
To **think three times** (三而思) within **one night** (一夜之中),
This is how they **refine** (所以精).
Thus they can **command ten thousand troops** (用万众之人).
Li Qun did not know that **military force** (师) is **troops** (众),
But **mistakenly took** (以为) it as **military strategist** (兵师),
This is **error** (误).

The **heart** (心) **arises** (生) from **things** (物) and **dies** (死) from **things** (物),
And **mechanism** (机) lies in the **eyes** (目).
*The Transmission* says:
*"The heart has **love and hatred** (爱恶) **emotions** (之情),
**Things** (物) have **flaws and merits** (否臧) **uses** (之用).
The **eyes** (目) **observe** (视) and **discern** (察) them **externally** (于外),
The **heart** (心) **responds** (应) and **judges** (度) them **internally** (于内).
If **good** (善), then **follow** (从) and **act** (行) upon it;
If **not** (否则), then **withdraw** (违) and **stop** (止).
This is how they **encourage virtue** (劝善) and **punish evil** (惩恶).
Li Qun **mistakenly took** (以) **Item羽’s** (项羽) **lack of mechanism** (昧机) as the **heart arising from things** (心生于物);
And **Fú Jiān’s** (符坚) **perception of mechanism** (见机) as the **heart dying from things** (心死于物).
He **completely failed** (殊不知) to grasp **flaws and merits** (有否臧之用).

Heaven’s **greatest self-interest** (至私) **generates** (生) **greatest public use** (至公).
*The Transmission* says:
*"Heaven’s **natural principle** (自然之理) is **subtle** (微) yet **unknowable** (不可知),
This is the **greatest self-interest** (至私).
Yet when **treacherous omens** (凶象) **appear** (见) as **Heaven’s warnings** (咎征),
**Humanity** (人) can **take heed** (儆戒) and **cultivate virtue** (修德).
When **thunder and fierce winds** (迅雷烈风) **stir** (动) **humanity** (人),
**Humanity** (人) can **fear** (恐惧) and **attain blessings** (致福).
This is how **greatest self-interest** (无恩) **generates** (生) **greatest public use** (大恩).
Li Qun **mistakenly took** (以) **Heaven and Earth’s lack of benevolence** (天地不仁) as **greatest public use** (大恩),
And **ten thousand things returning to Heaven** (万物归于天) as **bewildered** (蠢然).
This **greatly diverges** (殊背) from the *Yin Fu*’s **original meaning** (本意).

*The Transmission* says:
**The greatest delight is nature’s excess** (至乐性余),
**The greatest stillness is nature’s restraint** (至静性廉).
*"When **emotions** (情) are **unreleased** (未发), it is called **the Middle** (中);
To **guard the Middle** (守中) is called **constancy** (常),
Then **delight attains its purpose** (乐得其志) and **nature has excess** (性有余).
When **nature is tranquil and constant** (性安常), it is called **self-sufficiency** (自足);
Then **stillness attains its purpose** (静得其志) and **restraint is constant** (廉常足).
Li Qun **mistakenly took** (以) **excessiveness** (奢) as **delight’s nature** (乐性),
And **restraint** (廉) as **stillness** (静),
How **contrary** (殊乖) is this to the **supreme Dao/Way** (至道)!

Heaven’s **greatest self-interest** (至私) **becomes** (用) **greatest public use** (至公).
*The Transmission* says:
*"The **natural principle** (自然之理) is **subtle** (微) yet **unknowable** (不可知),
This is the **greatest self-interest** (至私)."*»

chunks.original_text: 自然之功，明而不可违，公之至也。 圣人体之亦然。 筌引《孙子》云：视卒如爱子，可以之俱死。 何也？ 擒之制在气。 《传》曰：擒物以气，制之以机，岂用小大之力乎？ 太公曰：岂以小大而相制哉？ 筌不知擒之义，误以禽兽。 注解引云玄龟食蛇，黄腰啖虎之类，为是悲哉！ 生者死之根，死者生之根。 恩生于害，害生于恩。 生者，人之所爱，以其厚于身。 太过则道丧，而死自来矣。 死者，人之所恶，以其损于事。 至明则道存。 而生自固矣。 福理所及谓之恩，祸乱所及谓之害，损己则为物之所益，害之生恩也。 筌引《孙子》用兵为生死，丁公、管仲为恩害。 异哉！ 愚人以天地文理圣，我以时物文理哲。 人以虞愚，我以不虞圣。 人以期其，我以不期其圣。 《传》曰：观天之运四时，察地之化万物，无所不知，而蔽之以无知，小恩于人，以蒙自养之谓也。 知四时之行，知万物之生，皆自然也。 故圣人于我以中自居之谓也。 故曰死生在我而已矣。 人之死亡，譬如沈水自溺，投火自焚，自取灭亡。 理国以道，在于损其事而已。 理军以权，在于亡其兵而已。 故无死机则不死矣，鬼神其如我何？ 圣人修身以安其家，理国以平天下，在乎立生机。 以自去其死性者，生之机也。 除死机以取其生情者，死之机也。 筌不天道，以愚人、圣人、体道愚昧之人而验天道，失之甚也。 故曰沈水入火，自取灭亡。 注在上矣。 自然之道静，故天地万物生 《传》曰：自然之道，无为而无不为。 动静皆得其性，静之至也。 静故能立天地，生万物，自然而然也。 伊尹曰：静之至，不知所以生也。 天地之道浸，故阴阳胜。 《传》曰：浸，微也。 天地之道，体着而用微，变通莫不归于正，微之渐也。 微渐故能分阴阳，成四时。 至刚至顺之谓也。 阴阳相推，而变化顺矣。 《传》曰：圣人变化顺阴阳之机。 天地之位自然，故因自然而冥之，利自然而用之，莫不得自然之道也。 是故圣人知自然之道不可违，因而制之。 注在文上。 至静之道，律历所不能契。 《传》曰：道之至静也，律历因而制之，不能叶其中鸟兽之谓也。 爰有奇器，是生万象； 八卦甲子，神机鬼藏。 《传》曰：八卦变异之伎，从是而生。 上则万象，下则万机。 用八卦而体天，用九畴而法地。 参之以气候，贯之以甲子，达之以神机，闭之以诡藏，奇谲之荡自然也。 阴阳相胜之术，昭昭乎进乎象矣。 《传》曰：阴阳相胜之术，恒微而不违乎本，明之信可明，故能通乎精曜象矣。

The **Sage** (圣人) embodies it thus. Li Qun cites *The Art of War* (《孙子》):

**Duke Zhou** (太公) said:
*"Is it by great or small force that one controls the other?"* (岂以小大而相制哉？)
Li Qun fails to grasp **the principle of capture** (擒之义), misapplying it to **wild beasts** (禽兽).
His annotations cite instances like *the tortoise devouring the snake* (玄龟食蛇), *the yellow-bellied beast preying on the tiger* (黄腰啖虎), etc.—how lamentable!

**Life** (生) is the root of **death** (死), and **death** is the root of **life**.
**Harm** (害) gives rise to **favor** (恩), and **favor** gives rise to **harm**.
**Life** is what people cherish, for it is **profoundly beneficial to the body** (厚于身).
Yet **excess** (太过) leads to **the Dao/Way’s ruin** (道丧), and **death** (死) comes naturally.
**Death** is what people abhor, for it **damages the affairs of life** (损于事).
**Clarity** (至明) preserves the Dao/Way, and **life** (生) is naturally secured.

**Favor** (恩) is the **principle of fortune** (福理) reaching others,
**Harm** (害) is the **principle of calamity** (祸乱) reaching others.
To **harm oneself** (损己) is to **benefit others** (物之所益)—
thus, **harm** (害) gives rise to **favor** (恩).

Li Qun cites *The Art of War* (《孙子》) on warfare as **life and death** (生死),
and **Ding Gong** (丁公) and **Guan Zhong** (管仲) on **favor and harm** (恩害).
How strange! The **foolish man** (愚人) regards **Heaven and Earth’s patterns and principles** (天地文理) as **Sagehood** (圣),
while I see **the Sagehood in adapting to time and things** (时物文理) as **philosophy** (哲).
Others consider **planning** (期) as **Sagehood** (圣),
but I consider **not planning** (不期) as **Sagehood** (圣).

*The Transmission* says:
*"Observe the **Heaven’s movement** (天之运) through the four seasons,
and **Earth’s transformation** (地之化) of all things—
to know all yet **conceal knowledge** (蔽之以无知),
to **bestow small favors** (小恩于人) while **nurturing oneself** (蒙自养),
is the way of the Sage."*

To know the **four seasons’ course** (四时之行) and **all things’ generation** (万物之生)
is to grasp **Nature’s spontaneity** (自然).
Thus, the Sage **resides in the Middle** (以中自居).

Hence it is said: *"Death and life lie within me alone."* (死生在我而已矣)
**Human death** is like **drowning in water** (沈水自溺) or **burning in fire** (投火自焚)—
**self-inflicted annihilation** (自取灭亡).

To **govern a state with the Dao/Way** (理国以道) lies in **reducing its affairs** (损其事).
To **command an army with strategy** (理军以权) lies in **abolishing its weapons** (亡其兵).
Thus, **without the mechanism of death** (无死机), there is **no death** (不死).
What can **ghosts and spirits** (鬼神) do to me?

The Sage **cultivates oneself** (修身) to **secure one’s family** (安其家),
governs a state (理国) to **pacify the world** (平天下),
by **establishing the mechanism of life** (立生机).
To **remove one’s deathly nature** (去其死性) is the **mechanism of life** (生之机).
To **eliminate the mechanism of death** (除死机) and **harness life’s vitality** (取其生情) is the **mechanism of death** (死之机).

Li Qun **does not comprehend Heaven’s Dao/Way** (不天道),
yet he **tests Heaven’s Dao/Way** (验天道) with the **foolish, the Sage, and those who embody the Dao/Way yet remain ignorant** (体道愚昧之人).
His error is **most grievous** (失之甚也).
Hence it is said: *"Drowning in water, burning in fire—self-inflicted annihilation."* (沈水入火，自取灭亡)
The annotation is **already made above** (注在上矣).

**Nature’s Dao/Way is supremely still** (自然之道静),
so **Heaven and Earth and all things are born** (天地万物生).
*The Transmission* says:
*"Nature’s Dao/Way **acts without action yet nothing remains undone** (无为而无不为).*
**Movement and stillness both attain their nature** (动静皆得其性)—
this is the **supreme stillness** (静之至).
Stillness **establishes Heaven and Earth** (能立天地),
**generates all things** (生万物),
**spontaneously and naturally** (自然而然)."

**Yi Yin** (伊尹) said:
*"Supreme stillness **does not know how it generates** (不知所以生).*
**Heaven and Earth’s Dao/Way is subtle** (浸), so **yin and yang prevail** (阴阳胜).
*The Transmission* says:
*"**Subtle** (浸) is **refined** (微).*
**Heaven and Earth’s Dao/Way** is **embodied yet applied subtly** (体着而用微),
**adapting and transforming** (变通) to **return to the norm** (归于正)—
this is the **gradual refinement of subtlety** (微之渐)."

**Gradual refinement of subtlety** (微渐) allows **yin and yang to be distinguished** (分阴阳),
**to complete the four seasons** (成四时).
This is **ultimate strength and ultimate compliance** (至刚至顺).
**Yin and yang** propel each other,
and **transformation proceeds in harmony** (变化顺).

*The Transmission* says:
*"The Sage **adapts and transforms** (变化) in **harmony with yin and yang’s mechanisms** (顺阴阳之机).*
**Heaven and Earth’s positions** are **naturally established** (自然),
so the Sage **follows Nature’s spontaneity** (因自然而冥之),
**harnesses its benefits** (利自然而用之),
and **nothing escapes Nature’s Dao/Way** (莫不得自然之道).

Thus, the Sage **knows Nature’s Dao/Way is unalterable** (不可违),
and **controls it accordingly** (因而制之).
The annotation is **already made above** (注在文上).

**Supreme stillness** (至静) **transcends all measure and reckoning** (律历所不能契).
*The Transmission* says:
*"The Dao/Way’s **supreme stillness** (至静), though **measured and regulated** (律历) may **follow and control** (因而制之),
**cannot conform to its inner essence** (不能叶其中)—
this is the **beastly ignorance** (鸟兽之谓).*

Here are **wondrous instruments** (奇器),
which **generate all phenomena** (是生万象).
**The Eight Trigrams and the Heavenly Stems-Earthly Branches** (八卦甲子) hold **divine mechanisms and mysterious concealments** (神机鬼藏).
*The Transmission* says:
*"The **Eight Trigrams’ shifting transformations** (八卦变异之伎) **emanate from this** (从是而生).
Above, it **manifests all phenomena** (则万象),
below, it **encompasses all mechanisms** (则万机).
Use the **Eight Trigrams to embody Heaven** (体天),
use the **Nine Categories** (九畴) to **model Earth** (法地).
**Correlate them with climate and qi** (参之以气候),
**thread them with Heavenly Stems-Earthly Branches** (贯之以甲子),
**penetrate them with divine mechanisms** (达之以神机),
**conceal them in guileful strategies** (闭之以诡藏)—
**the wondrous and deceptive sway of Nature** (奇谲之荡自然).

The **art of yin and yang’s mutual overcoming** (阴阳相胜之术)
is **clearly expressed in the symbols** (昭昭乎进乎象).
*The Transmission* says:
*"The **art of yin and yang’s mutual overcoming** (阴阳相胜之术)
**consistently operates subtly yet never deviates from its root** (恒微而不违乎本).
**Clarity’s truth is trustworthy** (明之信可明),
so it **penetrates the refined and luminous symbols** (能通乎精曜象矣)."»
